word_mean: 摩擦音：两个浆膜面相互摩擦引起的一种听诊音，例如心包摩擦时所闻及者

sentence.Network_en: I was hoping some of his genius might rub off.
sentence.Network_cn: 我希望他的才华也可以影响他人。

sentence.Network_en: Rub the surface of the wood in preparation for the varnish.
sentence.Network_cn: 打磨木头的表面，为刷清漆做准备。

sentence.Network_en: Nobody else believed that they had tried to rub out the pope.
sentence.Network_cn: 其他人都不相信他们试图杀死教皇。

jx.jx_en_mean: To perform a brisk rubbing of the body, as in massage.

jx.jx_cn_mean: 反复讲（令人不愉快的事）

jx.jx_en_mean: To obliterate by or as if by rubbing.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 擦掉，磨掉：通过或好象通过摩擦去掉

phrase.cizu_name: not have two — to rub together

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)have none or hardly any of the specified item, especially money
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)没有（或几乎没有）某物（尤指钱）

lj.lj_ly: she doesn't have two farthings to rub together.

jx.jx_en_mean: rub one's hands together to show keen satisfaction
jx.jx_cn_mean: 双手相擦以示极为满意

phrase.cizu_name: rub it in (或 rub someone's nose in something)

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)emphatically draw someone's attention to an embarrassing or painful fact
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)向某人反复提及尴尬的事（或令人痛苦的事）；揭某人的疮疤

lj.lj_ly: they don't just beat you, they rub it in.
lj.lj_ls: 他们不只是打你，而是揭你的疮疤。

jx.jx_en_mean: rub one's nose against someone else's in greeting (especially as traditional among Maoris and some other peoples)
jx.jx_cn_mean: （问候时）互相用鼻子摩擦（尤指毛利人和其他一些民族的传统问候方式）

jx.jx_en_mean: associate or come into contact with another person
jx.jx_cn_mean: 和（某人）接触，和（某人）接近，和（某人）密切往来

lj.lj_ly: he rubbed shoulders with TV stars at the party.
lj.lj_ls: 在聚会上他和电视明星接近。

jx.jx_en_mean: irritate or repel someone (as by stroking a cat against the lie of its fur)
jx.jx_cn_mean: 惹怒某人，触犯某人，使某人反感

jx.jx_en_mean: (Brit. informal)cope or manage without undue difficulty

lj.lj_ly: they rub along because their overheads are so low.
lj.lj_ls: 他们还算能对付过去，因为他们付出的经常管理费用很低。

jx.jx_en_mean: dry, smooth, or clean something by rubbing
be transferred by contact or association
jx.jx_cn_mean: （通过接触或交往而）对…产生影响

lj.lj_ly: when parents are having a hard time, their tension can easily &B{rub off on} the kids.
lj.lj_ls: 当父母日子不好过时，他们的紧张会很容易传染给孩子。

jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式，主北美)杀掉某人，干掉某人

jx.jx_en_mean: erase pencil marks with a rubber
jx.jx_cn_mean: （用橡皮擦）擦掉，抹掉（铅笔字迹）

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (as a verb): perhaps from Low German rubben, of unknown ultimate origin. The noun dates from the late 16th cent

entry.def: If you rub a part of your body, you move your hand or fingers backwards and forwards over it while pressing firmly.

example.ex: He rubbed his arms and stiff legs...
example.tran: 他按摩着自己的胳膊和僵硬的双腿。

example.ex: 'I fell in a ditch', he said, rubbing at a scrape on his hand.
example.tran: “我掉进沟里了”，他一边说着，一边揉着手上的擦伤。

entry.def: If you rub against a surface or rub a part of your body against a surface, you move it backwards and forwards while pressing it against the surface.

example.ex: A cat was rubbing against my leg...
example.tran: 一只猫在我腿上蹭来蹭去。

example.ex: He kept rubbing his leg against mine.
example.tran: 他不停地用腿蹭我的腿。

entry.def: If you rub an object or a surface, you move a cloth backward and forward over it in order to clean or dry it.

example.ex: She took off her glasses and rubbed them hard...
He rubbed and rubbed but couldn't seem to get clean.
example.tran: 他擦了又擦，可就是擦不干净。

entry.def: If you rub a substance into a surface or rub something such as dirt from a surface, you spread it over the surface or remove it from the surface using your hand or something such as a cloth.

example.ex: He rubbed oil into my back...
I pretended to rub a fleck of grit from one eye.
example.tran: 我假装拭去一只眼睛里的沙粒。

entry.def: If you rub two things together or if they rub together, they move backwards and forwards, pressing against each other.

example.ex: He rubbed his hands together a few times.
...the 650-mile rift that separates the Pacific and North American geological plates as they rub together.
example.tran: 太平洋和北美洲地质板块相互摩擦时产生的一条长达650英里的裂缝

entry.def: If something you are wearing or holding rubs, it makes you sore because it keeps moving backwards and forwards against your skin.

example.ex: Smear cream on to your baby's skin at the edges of the plaster to prevent it from rubbing.
example.tran: 在宝宝贴膏药的皮肤边缘涂上护肤霜，以防止膏药擦伤皮肤。

entry.def: Rub is used in expressions such as there's the rub and the rub is when you are mentioning a difficulty that makes something hard or impossible to achieve.

example.ex: 'What do you want to write about?'. And there was the rub, because I didn't yet know.
example.tran: “你想写什么？”难就难在这儿，因为我还不知道写什么。

entry.def: A massage can be referred to as a rub .

example.ex: She sometimes asks if I want a back rub.
example.tran: 她有时会问我想不想做个背部按摩。

entry.def: A rub is a substance that you massage into your skin.

example.ex: ...a fresh cucumber rub for your whole face.
example.tran: 用新鲜黄瓜给整张脸做的面膜

entry.tran: （尤用于美国英语）和（名人）接触，和（名人）交往
entry.def: If you rub shoulders with famous people, you meet them and talk to them. You can also say that you rub elbows with someone, especially in American English.

example.ex: He regularly rubbed shoulders with the likes of Elizabeth Taylor and Kylie Minogue.
example.tran: 他经常与伊丽莎白·泰勒和凯莉·米洛这样的人接触。

entry.tran: 无意中冒犯;无意中惹恼
entry.def: If you rub someone up the wrong way in British English, or rub someone the wrong way in American English, you offend or annoy them without intending to.

example.ex: What are you going to get out of him if you rub him up the wrong way?
example.tran: 你要是不小心把他惹毛了，你有什么好处？

means.word_mean: 2. the act of rubbing or wiping;

sentences.sentence: "he gave the hood a quick rub"

means.word_mean: 3. scrape or rub as if to relieve itching;

auth_sentence.content: Remove the bread and rub with the garlic clove.
auth_sentence.res_content: Remove the bread and rub with the garlic clove.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Remove the bread and rub with the garlic clove.

auth_sentence.content: Rub the beef all over with the mustard paste.
auth_sentence.res_content: Rub the beef all over with the mustard paste.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Rub the beef all over with the mustard paste.

auth_sentence.content: Rub a little of the butter into the flour.
auth_sentence.res_content: Rub a little of the butter into the flour.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Rub a little of the butter into the flour.

sentences.en: Go and rub your hands dry.
The floor has been rubbed clean and shiny.

sentences.cn: 她的多嘴多舌常常惹他发火。

means.word_mean: 擦掉；磨去；使减色(常与out，off或away连用)

sentences.en: The paint has been rubbed away from the edges of the table.
sentences.cn: 桌子边上的漆都被蹭掉了。

sentences.en: The journal rubs against the bearing surface.
Their shoulders rubbed together as they walked.
sentences.cn: 他们走路时，两人的肩膀互相摩擦着。

sentences.en: The mud will rub off easily.
It rubs to work under such an obstinate man.
sentences.cn: 在这种蛮不讲理的人手下工作真令人恼火。

jushi.english: Rub this oil on your skin.
He bent over and rubbed his sore ankle.
jushi.chinese: 他弯下腰去揉搓发痛的脚踝。

jushi.english: He was rubbing his hands all the time as if he was washing them, and smiling without stopping.
jushi.chinese: 他一直在搓着手,好像是在洗手,并且不停地笑。
